quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This year I decided to really get into the spirit of Halloween.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [screaming upon seeing pumpkin-headed Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [screaming then laughing] It may have been the costliest decision I’ve ever made.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: My greased up head went into the pumpkin no problem, but ...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It won’t budge.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I can’t get it out. Try again!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I mean, I could try destroying the pumpkin...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [as Jim approaches with a knife] Jim, no. No. No! No!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: But as Jim and I discovered...  No! ... any blow to the pumpkin itself could prove fatal to me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: At first I drove myself crazy thinking about the things I should have done differently. I never should have played that joke on Erin. I never should have hollowed out this damn pumpkin in the first place. Then I realized that I was being silly. I mean the pumpkin should rot off of my head in a month or two. Right?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Hey guys.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Pam, what are you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I am Dr. Cinderella.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Cece’s really into princesses now. So we decided to turn them into a positive female role models.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I’m an oncologist and you are a dog.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: No, I’m a puppy. Dang it! I was worried that would happen.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It’s Okay.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Uh, Jim, you’re not dressed up at all.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sure I am. I am... one of the Men in Black guys. [to Pam, under his breath] Can I have your sunglasses?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Jim, come on. I thought we were past this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So the sports marketing business that Jim told everyone about except for me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: There’s a big investment lunch today, so I decided to skip the costume.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Unless he has a secret costume that he told everyone about except for me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Gettin’ a lot of mileage out of this, aren’t ya?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, well, get used to it, bud.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: A jitterbug. [giggles] You guys look great! Just a reminder. The party is right after lunch, so make sure you get all your work done before that or throw it out. Any questions?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: The senator will be joining us later.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Not a question.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, it wasn’t.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Excellent. That reminds me, has anyone seen Treble? Anyone? I could have sworn I saw some Treble somewhere.

quotes.speaker: HCT
quotes.line: [singing]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh, ladies and gentlemen, Here Comes Treble!

quotes.speaker: HCT
quotes.line: [sings Karma Chameleon]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Aaah! [everyone clapping] So good!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What lab did these little clones escape from?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: My Cornell a capella group.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You were in an a capella group?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: You went to Cornell?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yah! ah. Okay. Ha ha ha ha. But you have no idea how lucky you are because HCT is doing a set at our halloween party.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Ugh. I don’t want to sit through a whole concert of that.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: I do. I love the boss’s interests.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Atta boy Clark!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Where you boys stayin? How does it work in the rooms? Do you get a privacy partition?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No. Nope. Nope nope nope. Stay away.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You know what I just realized? They might actually call me up to solo on George Michael’s Faith. That was one of my signature songs. Oh, man. That would be insane. I’m so not prepared.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Are you sure you’re okay with me putting in this much money.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah. I mean, listen if we’re gonna do this thing, we should do it right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You’re the best.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I kind of am. It’s crazy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay. I’ll see you in a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim. Look I’m eating you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Shut up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ha ha. Hey Erin, look, these are Nerds. I’m eating Jims.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [laughing] Must eat more Jims. Oink oink oink oink.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [laughing hysterically] Stop it! Stop it! Stop it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh no, I’m spilling Jim all over the carpet. [laughing]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Stop it stop it stop it stop it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [picking up spilled candy] Hello little pill. What do you do?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Dumatril is licensed to treat anxiety symptoms, such as panic attacks, excessive worrying, and fear. Translation: There’s a madman in our midst.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay I give up. What are you?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: I’m sexy Toby.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [laughing] Gross. I love it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Dumatril!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Something wrong Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Dumatril.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This is a pill that I found here in the office. But it’s not for worms or eczema like any normal pill. It’s not for any disorder of the body. [whispering] It’s for a disorder of the mind.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: The mind is part of the body.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, this is a pill that combats insanity, okay? Whoever is taking it is not only insane... [whispering] They are now off their meds.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Dwight, our co-workers’ health issues are really none of our business so-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Why are you trying so hard to bury this thing, huh? What’s going on Nellie? Talk to me.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Hm?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: It’s my pill. I have an anxiety issue and I’m not ashamed of that, But I’m not loving the idea of Dwight having that information. I once saw him yell at Phyllis for sneezing wrong.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Yeah, you’re right. This man needs to be apprehended.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I’ll get my apprehension kit.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ruh duh duh da dudes! What’s up?

quotes.speaker: HCT
quotes.line: [mumbled responses]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I know that it’s pathetic to re-live your college years, but cut me some slack, Okay? Because I was a freaking rock star in college. When I joined Here Comes Treble, that’s when I became somebody. When I got the nickname "Boner Champ," that is when I became me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You didn’t come here to sit in a room, right? You came here for some intergenerational bro time. Well, now’s your chance! I’m here. You got Qs; I got As.

quotes.speaker: HCT Member #1
quotes.line: Did you say you’ve got AIDS?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No, I don’t have AIDS. That’s not what I said. Next question.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You don’t have any-- Any questions about the old days? [clears throat] You at least want to know why they call me Boner Champ?

quotes.speaker: HCT Member #2
quotes.line: I thought Broccoli Rob was the Boner Champ.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I’m sorry, what?

quotes.speaker: HCT Member #2
quotes.line: I just thought Broccoli Rob was the Boner Champ.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Broccoli Rob was Broccoli Rob. Andy Bernard is the Boner Champ.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: I didn’t realize that everybody here dresses up every year.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Me neither.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: It’s Halloween. That is really, really good timing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I was just talking to some of the actives, and they think that you’re Boner Champ.

quotes.speaker: Broccoli Rob
quotes.line: [on computer monitor] I’m so sorry! I don’t know how that could have happened.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Did you maybe tell them that or...?

quotes.speaker: Broccoli Rob
quotes.line: I just-- I just started yappin’ about the old days, and I guess the wine coolers were flowing, and, you know, somehow things just got hinky.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Could you just call them and tell them the truth? 'Cause I know it’s really stupid, but it’s also really, really, really important.

quotes.speaker: Broccoli Rob
quotes.line: Will do. I love you, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Love you too.

quotes.speaker: Businessman #1
quotes.line: So the workspace looks awesome.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Businessman #2
quotes.line: And the graphic designer is going to be sending in some of the logo treatments. I can’t wait to see them.

quotes.speaker: Businessman #3
quotes.line: You guys rock. [round of fistbumps]

quotes.speaker: Businessman #1
quotes.line: I killed it.

quotes.speaker: Businessman #2
quotes.line: I’ve also been running the numbers and between our backers and our own investments, we’re looking great for a full year on this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, uh, is it too late to get in?

quotes.speaker: Businessman #3
quotes.line: Oh Jim, I explained everything. So you’re all set.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, I actually talked to my wife and we’d really like to uh you know, invest - get in on the ground floor.

quotes.speaker: Businessman #2
quotes.line: Wow, well what level of investment were you thinking about?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We were thinking somewhere between five - ten thousand? I can do the full ten thousand. We should just - [blows air] - all in.

quotes.speaker: Businessman #3
quotes.line: Welcome aboard!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right. [laughs] Awesome. Cool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hi Daryl. I’m just here to smear some peanut butter on my forehead.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: You know, to uh, to protect his brain from the nanobots that the government put in the air conditioning.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That makes sense to you, right? Or does it sound... crazy?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I can’t really picture it. Can you... get it on there. Yeah. And maybe, get the cheeks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So this makes sense then. Or is it crazy?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Get under your chin first. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Is that where the nanobots like to come in?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Take it all the way up to your lip, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Is that how they like to get in?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah, that’s crazy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [whispering] I don’t know. I just don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yo! Bad boys of a capella.

quotes.speaker: HCT
quotes.line: [mumbling] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Heard any good stories lately? Or new twists on old stories?

quotes.speaker: HCT Member #3
quotes.line: Yeah, I got a call from Broccoli Rob. I guess you really are the Boner Champ.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Did he tell you how I got the name?

quotes.speaker: HCT Member #3
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Spring sing ‘95. Got completely ripped on Bud Dries. I had sex with a snowman. I just went at that thing. Cold would have stopped most people but I stayed locked in, you know. Took the face off. It just seemed easier that way.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: And I told Phyllis not to put it out, but she insisted. So, anyway... Hi! Oh, Oscar, remember my husband, the senator?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Senator Lipton, nice to see you.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.line: Nice to see you Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Wait a second, who designed this spread? The sweets and savories are all mixed together. This is mayhem!

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.line: So Oscar, you’re a dinosaur.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Actually I’m the electoral college.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.line: Ouch! Right on target.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You know what? This is outrageous. I have to find Phyllis. You two talk, okay? Sorry babe.. Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.line: God, it’s just so good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I, uh, huh, just [chuckles nervously]

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.line: All having this wonderful Halloween gathering. Excuse me, is that punch?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: They didn’t know about the snowman story, and when I told ‘em, they were not impressed.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: What is with these turkeys?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Right?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Hey! You better do ‘Faith.’ You get me?

quotes.speaker: HCT Member #3
quotes.line: We don’t know it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: So learn it. You all go to Cornell, you’re like eight Rain men. Just learning the friggin’ song.

quotes.speaker: HCT Member #3
quotes.line: Look, I know it was big with the old guys, but--

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Buts... are for pooping. Okay? Make it work. You have to or Andy will flip out... And make it a surprise, please. [to Pete] This isn’t stupid.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Hey Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Are... are you me?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh my goodness, look. Look at this.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Yeah. I...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [unintelligible mumbling]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Yes. I thought I’d you know, be you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Look at.. Look at me. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: [laughing] It’s funny right? [Toby starts to lean in for a kiss, then runs away]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: All right. All right, just ...stay focused on the pill.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Okay, look Dwight, let’s just call this thing off. I mean, it’s just an anxiety pill. Lots of people have anxiety.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You think I don’t have anxiety? I have anxiety all the time. Every waking moment of my life is sheer torture. I have land disputes I’ve got to settle and idiot cousins to protect. And ne’er- do- well siblings to take care of. But I don’t need some stupid pill to get me through all this.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Cool. Free upper.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ah ha! Ha!!! The jig is up, psychopath! Ah yeah! Gotcha!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Don’t dog catch me!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Gotcha! Yeah! Let’s see ya get out of this web, huh?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Let me out!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: The pill is mine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Get her out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Stop baggin’ my head!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh Dwight, look, its just a pill, all right? It’s for anxiety. I take it every day. And it makes me feel better. And maybe it could help you too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, how’d it go?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh man, it was great. They were great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Did you end up investing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I did, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: How much?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uh, man, by the end I guess it was about... ten...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: About ten?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ten. It was the full ten.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah. Yeah. It’s a good thing we talked about it though, because we had to...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No yeah. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So did everybody ...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Did everybody end up investing ten thousand?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Um, oh man, I don’t actually know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: They weren’t really talking that much about money. They just said, We’re good with investing and then I...and I...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ladies and gentlemen, Here Comes Treble!

quotes.speaker: HCT
quotes.line: [vocalizing]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: They said they were done with the investing and then you volunteered ten thousand dollars?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, no, I had to. Look, I needed to look like a team player, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So you invested ten thousand dollars to look like a team player?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You weren’t there.

quotes.speaker: HCT
quotes.line: [singing ‘I’ll Be’]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It was very clear that ten thousand was what we had...we should talk about it later.

quotes.speaker: HCT
quotes.line: [singing ‘I’ll Be’ directly to Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Talk about it now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Jim, that was most of our savings.

quotes.speaker: HCT
quotes.line: [still singing]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Wait! Wait. Hold on. Where’s the band? ‘Cause there’s just no way you guys are making this magic with just your mouths.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Yeah.  That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: What, am I overdoing it? No. No.

quotes.speaker: HCT
quotes.line: [singing]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: We said some. We said ‘some.’

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We’ll talk about it later.

quotes.speaker: HCT
quotes.line: [singing]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: We said part not all.

quotes.speaker: HCT
quotes.line: [singing ‘Car Wash’]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Yes! All right!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh Man! [clapping]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: That’s how you do that! Whoo!

quotes.speaker: HCT
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Show some pride. This is crap.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I agree. Yes, crap. Continue.

quotes.speaker: HCT Member #3
quotes.line: Now folks, by special request, we’re going to take it a little old school. There is a former Trebler in this room.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Who?

quotes.speaker: HCT Member #3
quotes.line: It’s Mr. Andy Bernard!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: [clapping]

quotes.speaker: HCT
quotes.line: [singing ‘Faith’]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No. Do not sing that. Do not... Oh man...

quotes.speaker: HCT Member #3
quotes.line: He reminded us today of how much he means to us. And we certainly seem to mean a lot to him, so without any further ado, here’s an old Treble classic.

quotes.speaker: HCT
quotes.line: [singing ‘Faith’]

quotes.speaker: Broccoli Rob
quotes.line: [on flat screen tv] [singing lead of Faith]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Whoa! Whoa! What the hell is Broccoli Rob doing here?

quotes.speaker: HCT Member #3
quotes.line: She said you wanted to hear ‘Faith’. That’s Broccoli Rob’s signature song.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That’s my signature song.

quotes.speaker: HCT Member #3
quotes.line: I really didn’t know that man. I just thought you wanted to hear it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Russell, I’m dressed like George Michael.

quotes.speaker: HCT Member #3
quotes.line: I thought you were Adam Lambert.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Wha...?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: The more I hear about all this a capella drama, the more I think it’s kind of pathetic. But when you’re with someone, you put up with the stuff that makes you lose respect for them, and that is love.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Are you okay?

quotes.speaker: Broccoli Rob
quotes.line: [on screen] He’s still mad.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Shut up, Broccoli.

quotes.speaker: Broccoli Rob
quotes.line: Champ, I feel awful about this whole thing. Russell called me up. And they said they needed 20 cc’s of George Michael stat. So just... Wham! I sprang into action. You know me. I assumed you wanted to hear me do your signature number.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You thought I wanted to sit in the audience like some slutty Treb rat? A man’s signature solo is his for life, okay? That’s group policy and you know it.

quotes.speaker: Broccoli Rob
quotes.line: Look, it’s not my fault that I still live near campus, and it’s my duty as an alum to be friendly to the young guys., and stop in two, three times a week.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Just don’t do the song anymore.

quotes.speaker: Broccoli Rob
quotes.line: I tell you what, we’ll have a sing-off for it. You pick twelve alums from any year to back you up and I’ll do the same, and I’m so confident that I’ll win, I won’t even warm up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Fine, go ahead. Thrash your pipes.

quotes.speaker: Broccoli Rob
quotes.line: My pipes are primo, Champ. Why don’t you ask Trey Anastasio about my pipes?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I knew you would go there, you son of a bitch!

quotes.speaker: Broccoli Rob
quotes.line: He said, and I quote, ‘Hey Rob, nice pipes’. That happened!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: OK, fine, yeah. that’s one guy’s opinion!

quotes.speaker: Broccoli Rob
quotes.line: That's real.  'That’ll never change!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Okay!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Doesn’t mean you’re the best singer ever. Dick.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I thought that concert was pretty great.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oh yeah. I decided that acapelca music is awesome.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: They lost me when they sang ‘Monster Mash’. That song obviously glorifies the occult.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Angela, it’s Halloween. You have to sing ‘Monster Mash’.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh you have to Jim? You literally have to?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No I’m just, I’m saying, what would happen if they didn’t sing it? Would they go to jail? Would they be shot?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay. We’ll, just forget it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No! No, I’m interested. I mean I think everybody’s interested in why they have to sing it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Because it is Halloween. So if you’re going to sing a concert, it’s a good idea to throw that one in.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, yeah, no, no. It’s a good idea to brush your teeth. But you have to um, feed your children. Send them to school. You know, all things you can’t do if you just keep singing ‘Monster Mash.’

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: It turns out, that Pam? Really, really hates ‘Monster Mash.’ I mean like, never bring that song up in front of her. Even though Jim was making great points, like, in favor of the song, Pam was like, No! Hate it! Stupid!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: This is all so silly right? What am I gonna do? Move back to Cornell?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [laughing] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I mean, what if we did that? Like we got jobs and we were happy all the time?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh well, Andy, we’re not moving to Cornell.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Duh. I know. That would be insane.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It could totally work though. I don’t know why we wouldn’t. Oh my god are we doing this?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oy. Andy, what’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: If I am not Boner Champ, I don’t know who I am.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Well, um, you know maybe you’re the wise old guy that the new uh, B-O-N-E-R champ looks up to. You know, you could just--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Make a donation.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Well, I was gonna say, be a mentor.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yes. I am gonna make a donation. And it just so happens that I know someone who works at the Bernard Family Foundation. Her name is mom.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [whispering] I want some of those pills.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh, well good for you. I mean, you’ll need a prescription.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, no. No, no, no. no. They’re not for me. They’re for my cousin Mose. He’s just having a tough time, being wifeless, and a high pressure job and his crazy cousin Mose. Other cousin Mose.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Mm. Got it. Well, you tell Mose that he’s a good man and that I hope he feels better.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Which one? Mose or the real Mose?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: The real Mose.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He says Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [on phone] Mom, I had this really charitable idea to set up this scholarship for a capella kids at Cornell and just need to wire some money over there. [pause] What?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: What’s wrong?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: My parents are broke.
